text: So got some good catch up with my modeler friend, he had a 3 week holiday lucky bugger!

So its a bit unfair to call it bad. Big problem is pinching in various areas which you can check easier by having a blind shader with high spec and doing a turntable - it should show up the pinched areas and help address them. Other big problem is variation of panel / windows inset - so some of them seem to vary between being slightly outset to going inset and need to be more consistent. Again the spec highlights should show this up

We reckon stuff like helmets or phones aren’t inherently bad - what you want is to have something detailed and lots of areas you can focus and showcase. Also suggested if a telephone having also the table it’s on and some surrounding models to make a piece of it

On the whole though you’re doing great, environment is a good thing to be starting in as a career. We think focus on smaller scope - like a smaller object or just the cockpit etc.. - so you can get less hung up and really dial in nice detailed modeling. Combined with your job there’s no reason you shouldn’t have chances to pivot into modeling full time eventually
